001package squidpony.squidgrid.mapping.styled;
002
003/**
004 * An enumeration of all the kinds of dungeon that DungeonGen
005 * knows how to draw already. Each value has a Javadoc description.
006 * Created by Tommy Ettinger on 3/10/2015.
007 */
008public enum TilesetType {
009    /**
010     * A generally useful kind of dungeon for ruins or underground manufactured areas.
011     */
012    DEFAULT_DUNGEON,
013    /**
014     * A good general kind of cave, with long distances between merging paths.
015     */
016    CAVES_LIMIT_CONNECTIVITY,
017    /**
018     * Only usable if using Chebyshev distances; many connections are diagonal-only.
019     */
020    CAVES_TINY_CORRIDORS,
021    /**
022     * Most parts of the cave are large and open, but tiny corridors link them, providing hiding places.
023     */
024    CORNER_CAVES,
025    /**
026     * Very basic demo dungeon.
027     */
028    HORIZONTAL_CORRIDORS_A,
029    /**
030     * Slightly less basic demo dungeon.
031     */
032    HORIZONTAL_CORRIDORS_B,
033    /**
034     * A bit more complexity in this demo dungeon.
035     */
036    HORIZONTAL_CORRIDORS_C,
037    /**
038     * A reference implementation of where you can place walls; mostly floor.
039     */
040    LIMIT_CONNECTIVITY_FAT,
041    /**
042     * A reference implementation of where you can place walls; mostly wall.
043     */
044    LIMITED_CONNECTIVITY,
045    /**
046     * A generally good maze; MAZE_A and MAZE_B should both be interchangeable, but not on the same map.
047     */
048    MAZE_A,
049    /**
050     * A generally good maze; MAZE_A and MAZE_B should both be interchangeable, but not on the same map.
051     */
052    MAZE_B,
053    /**
054     * A map that's less dungeon-like than the others, with lots of open space.
055     */
056    OPEN_AREAS,
057    /**
058     * An excellent natural cave style that looks worn down haphazardly, as by burrowing creatures or deep rivers.
059     */
060    REFERENCE_CAVES,
061    /**
062     * Mostly open, kinda weird.
063     */
064    ROOMS_AND_CORRIDORS_A,
065    /**
066     * Mostly open, but with long corridors that should be a good fit for ranged combat.
067     */
068    ROOMS_AND_CORRIDORS_B,
069    /**
070     * A nice old-school roguelike map, with thin corridors and rectangular rooms.
071     */
072    ROOMS_LIMIT_CONNECTIVITY,
073    /**
074     * A thing of beauty. Good for maps that need to seem otherworldly or unusual, like heavenly planes.
075     */
076    ROUND_ROOMS_DIAGONAL_CORRIDORS,
077    /**
078     * A more open cave, but portions of this may seem artificial. Consider alternating with REFERENCE_CAVES .
079     */
080    SIMPLE_CAVES,
081    /**
082     * Kinda... not the best map. Very predictable.
083     */
084    SQUARE_ROOMS_WITH_RANDOM_RECTS
085}
086
